nodes.documentation:
@title Bloom account registry
@notice Account Registry Logic allows users to link multiple addresses to the same owner

endInitialization().details: Allows the initializer to end the initialization period

params._currentAddress: Address to which user wants to link another address. May currently be linked to another address
params._currentAddressSig: Signed message from address currently associated with account confirming intention
params._newAddress: Address to add to account. Cannot currently be linked to another address
params._newAddressSig: Signed message from new address confirming ownership by the sender
params._nonce: hex string used when generating sigs to make them one time use

migrateLink(address,address).details: Gives initializer privileges to write links during the initialization period without signatures

params._currentAddress: Address to which user wants to link another address. May currently be linked to another address
params._newAddress: Address to add to account. Cannot currently be linked to another address

params._addressToRemove: Address to unlink from all other addresses
params._nonce: hex string used when generating sigs to make them one time use
params._unlinkSignature: Signed message from address currently associated with account confirming intention to unlink

methods.constructor: The AccountRegistry constructor configures the signing logic implementation

linkAddresses(address,bytes,address,byte.notice: Add an address to an existing id on behalf of a user to pay the gas costs

migrateLink(address,address).notice: Submit link completed prior to deployment of this contract

unlinkAddress(address,bytes32,bytes).notice: Remove an address from a link relationship

userdoc.notice: Account Registry Logic allows users to link multiple addresses to the same owner
